questions.question: Can you describe a robotics project you’ve worked on? What was your role and what technologies did you use?
questions.canonical_answer: I designed and programmed a robot using ROS, sensors, and control algorithms, handling integration, testing, and performance tuning.

questions.question: How do you approach designing and tuning a control system for a robotic manipulator or mobile robot?
questions.canonical_answer: I model the system, choose a controller like PID or MPC, tune parameters through simulation, and refine using real-world testing.

questions.question: What sensors and perception techniques have you used for robot localization and navigation?
questions.canonical_answer: I’ve used LiDAR, IMU, cameras, SLAM algorithms, sensor fusion, and path planning methods for accurate localization.

questions.question: Which programming languages, frameworks, or simulation tools do you use for robotics development?
questions.canonical_answer: I use Python, C++, ROS, Gazebo, RViz, and sometimes MATLAB or Unity for simulation and testing.

questions.question: How do you integrate hardware and software components in a robotic system?
questions.canonical_answer: I interface sensors and actuators with controllers, use ROS nodes for communication, and test modules incrementally to ensure reliability.

questions.question: Can you explain a time when your robot didn’t perform as expected? How did you diagnose and fix the issue?
questions.canonical_answer: I reproduced the issue, checked logs and sensor data, isolated modules, and applied fixes to calibration, code, or hardware connections.

questions.question: What recent advances in robotics or AI excite you the most, and how do you see them shaping the field?
questions.canonical_answer: Advances in deep learning, real-time perception, and robot learning excite me as they make robots more adaptable and autonomous.
